Operations houses the command center and the main computer. Upgrading Operations increases the overall capability of the Station by unlocking more buildings for construction.
The central, main structure of the starbase, the Assembly Chambers house the main command center, communications relays and warp control for the station itself.
Harvesting arrays used to collect Collisional Plasma from the heart of the storm.
Harvesting arrays used to collect Collisional Plasma from the heart of the storm.
Harvesting arrays used to collect Collisional Plasma from the heart of the storm.
Plasma storage tanks used to store harvested Collisional Plasma before processing.
Plasma storage tanks used to store harvested Collisional Plasma before processing.
Harvesting arrays used to collect Magnetic Plasma from the heart of the storm.
Harvesting arrays used to collect Magnetic Plasma from the heart of the storm.
Harvesting arrays used to collect Magnetic Plasma from the heart of the storm.
Plasma storage tanks used to store harvested Magnetic Plasma before processing.
Plasma storage tanks used to store harvested Magnetic Plasma before processing.
Harvesting arrays used to collect Active Plasma from the heart of the storm.
Harvesting arrays used to collect Active Plasma from the heart of the storm.
Harvesting arrays used to collect Active Plasma from the heart of the storm.
Plasma storage tanks used to store harvested Active Plasma before processing.
Plasma storage tanks used to store harvested Active Plasma before processing.
A massive industrial structure which processes the plasma harvested from Plasma Storms into a useful material.
A structure designed for conferences with delegates from other factions.
This structure houses the primary coordination center for all strategic operations.
An industrial processing structure used to harvest materials from scrapped stations.

The Command Control module of the starbase is used to coordinate assaults and defensive maneuvers amongst members of the Alliance. As a beating heart of the operational structure of the Alliance's plans, the Command Control is a key hub of activity on board the starbase.

The Alliance Starbase's Shield Modulator is an advanced deflector shield array that can alter the harmonics and frequencies of the shields, resulting in a less predictable target for enemy weapons. The module uses on-the-fly data analysis of incoming attacks to best divert the impact of hits, and can mean the difference between life and death in a firefight.

The Electro-Plasma-System Distributor is an experimental weapons upgrade technology used in prototype starbase design. The module uses complex combinations of heat induction and light refractive focusing to enhance the potency of energy based weapons such as phasers and disruptors.

The Electro-Plasma-System Distributor is an experimental weapons upgrade technology used in prototype starbase design. The module uses complex combinations of heat induction and light refractive focusing to enhance the potency of energy based weapons such as phasers and disruptors.

The Electro-Plasma-System Distributor is an experimental weapons upgrade technology used in prototype starbase design. The module uses complex combinations of heat induction and light refractive focusing to enhance the potency of energy based weapons such as phasers and disruptors.

Weapons such as photon torpedoes benefit hugely from the application of the new experimental Exographic Targeting Array that has recently been field tested on starbases to great effect. Torpedoes that are fired as normal through launch tubes can now be given pinpoint accurate target tracing and enhanced physical force detonation, resulting in an even more destructive outcome than before.

Weapons such as photon torpedoes benefit hugely from the application of the new experimental Exographic Targeting Array that has recently been field tested on starbases to great effect. Torpedoes that are fired as normal through launch tubes can now be given pinpoint accurate target tracing and enhanced physical force detonation, resulting in an even more destructive outcome than before.

Weapons such as photon torpedoes benefit hugely from the application of the new experimental Exographic Targeting Array that has recently been field tested on starbases to great effect. Torpedoes that are fired as normal through launch tubes can now be given pinpoint accurate target tracing and enhanced physical force detonation, resulting in an even more destructive outcome than before.

Access to highly coveted cloaking technology from the Romulan and Klingon Empires is now more widely available. As a result, most R&D teams and defense specialists have been working on effective countermeasures. The latest attempt to expose cloaked vessels is the Tachyon Detector, a device that floods nearby space with temporary bursts of tachyon radiation in an attempt to disrupt the cloak and make ships visible to sensors once again.

Produces Dilithium, a crystalline mineral required when researching new technologies and building advanced ship components. Upgrading Dilithium Generators increases the amount that is produced, and unlocks the production of Σ-Dilithium at high levels.

Produces Dilithium, a crystalline mineral required when researching new technologies and building advanced ship components. Upgrading Dilithium Generators increases the amount that is produced, and unlocks the production of Σ-Dilithium at high levels.
Stores all collected Dilithium and Σ-Dilithium. Upgrade the Warehouse to increase its capacity and unlock Σ-Dilithium capacity at high levels.

The Treasury unlocks access to the Lockbox, increases the mining speed and protected cargo of Survey ships, and increases the cargo capacity of all ships.

Upgrading the Treasury to level 40 adds bonus Prime Particles to the daily Optical Diodes claim in the gift section of the store until all Prime Territory research is completed.
The Shipyard is instrumental in ship construction. Upgrade this building to get access to more ships and increase the speed of ship construction.
The Ship Hangar is where extra ships are stored when they are not currently used in the active fleet. Upgrade the Hangar to increase the amount of Ships that can be owned.
Ship A. Ships can be assigned, managed and upgraded via Ship Management. Every additional Drydock increases the amounts of Ships that can be deployed.
Ship B. Ships can be assigned, managed and upgraded via Ship Management. Every additional Drydock increases the amounts of Ships that can be deployed.
Ship C. Ships can be assigned, managed and upgraded via Ship Management. Every additional Drydock increases the amounts of Ships that can be deployed.

Produces Parsteel, an alloy with immense tensile strength used to build Station buildings. Upgrading Parsteel Generators increases the amount that is produced, and unlocks the production of Σ-Parsteel at high levels.
Ship D. Ships can be assigned, managed and upgraded via Ship Management. Every additional Drydock increases the amounts of Ships that can be deployed.
Ship E. Ships can be assigned, managed and upgraded via Ship Management. Every additional Drydock increases the amounts of Ships that can be deployed.
Ship F. Ships can be assigned, managed and upgraded via Ship Management. Every additional Drydock increases the amounts of Ships that can be deployed.
The Armada Control Center allows you to initiate Armada attacks on hostile targets. Upgrade the Center to increase the number of allied ships that can join your Armada attacks.
Here is where your Officers stay when they are not assigned. Promote and Level your Officers via the Officer Screen.
The Research Lab is vital for the discovery of new technologies. Here, new Ships, buildings or supporting technologies are unlocked.
New ship hulls are researched and unlocked here before becoming available in the Shipyard.

The Armory allows access to ship refits that unlock new active abilities, as well as increasing the Hull Health, Shield Health, and Mitigation stats of all ships. 

Upgrading the Armory to certain levels will also grant enough refit shards to fully unlock the refits for specific ships. 

Level 26: Mayflower, D3, Legionary
Level 28: Saladin, Bortas, Centurion
Level 42: Kelvin, K'T'inga, Valdore
Level 53: Northcutt, Vor'cha, Corvus

Produces Parsteel, an alloy with immense tensile strength used to build Station buildings. Upgrading Parsteel Generators increases the amount that is produced, and unlocks the production of Σ-Parsteel at high levels.
Provides the Station with a strong shield. Upgrade the Shield Generator to increase the shield's hitpoints.
Processes Raw Materials. Refine Raw Ore, Crystal, Gas, and other materials found across the galaxy.
Detect approaching enemy ships. Upgrade the Sensor Station to increase the warning time.
The Shuttle Bay allows officers to be sent on Away Team Assignments.
Defense Platforms are the last line of Defense for the Station. Behind defending ships they provide additional fire support. Upgrade to increase the Platform's combat performance.

Produces Parsteel, an alloy with immense tensile strength used to build Station buildings. Upgrading Parsteel Generators increases the amount that is produced, and unlocks the production of Σ-Parsteel at high levels.
The Exocomp Factory grants the ability to activate and improve Consumables, unlock additional Exocomps, and earn Axionic Chips.
The Scrapyard lets you scrap ships for resources and materials. Upgrade to allow scrapping of more advanced ship classes, and to increase scrapping speed.
Ship G. Ships can be assigned, managed and upgraded via Ship Management. Every additional Drydock increases the amounts of Ships that can be deployed.

Protects the stored Parsteel and Σ-Parsteel from enemy attacks. Upgrade the Vault for additional security, and to unlock the protection of Σ-Parsteel at high levels.

Build in order to gain access to the <color=#ffc926>Holodeck</color> to purchase missions from previous arcs. The <color=#ffc926>Holodeck</color> increases base Piercing stats for all ships, base Materials Cost Efficiency for ship upgrades and base FKR reputation from hostiles and armadas. 

At Operations level 32 with the <color=#ffc926>Holodeck</color> unlocked you get a daily gift of Holo-Field Amplifiers.

Every 5 levels of the <color=#ffc926>Holodeck</color>, unlock new missions, and receive shards for Enterprise-E Data, Enterprise-E Troi and Enterprise-E Picard from the Holodeck section of the Recruit Store.

Produces Tritanium, an alloy many times harder than diamonds, used to construct mighty ships. Upgrading Tritanium Generators increases the amount that is produced, and unlocks the production of Σ-Tritanium at high levels.

Constructed with the aid of ancient Progenitor architectural drawings. Activates the station as a node on the Progenitor Subspace Network, allowing allied stations to instantly share computational processing power across vast distances.
Enter into <color=#ffc926>Command Center</color> to assign your <color=#ffc926>Fleet Commanders</color> in order to optimize your fleet's capabilities.

The Mess Hall is the heart and soul of any station or ship. Crew members come together between shifts or for meal times here. At peak hours, this is the busiest part of any facility. With a bustling Mess Hall, even the deepest reaches of distant space can feel just like home.

The Artifact Gallery houses a collection of valuable artifacts that have been acquired from across the quadrant and beyond. Visitors to the station are welcome to see these rare and fascinating objects on display.

The benevolent Q has graced your station with his presence and left an impressionable mark upon the Court. By adding opulence and grandeur to the Court of Q, the building will grant you greater rewards and access to more of Q's Trials.

A mysterious building and a front for an even more mysterious organization. The Facade increases base Damage of ships in Wave Defense, base Hull Health for all ships and base Officer Stats. 

If you have unlocked Armada Quick Start in the Section 31 Faction, the daily gift of Armada Countdown Speed Ups is increased.

The War Room serves as your connection to the Order of Ko’tal - a secret order of warriors doing battle to prove their honor and earn the ultimate rewards. Upgrade the War Room to increase Warchest rewards, Isolytic Damage, Officer Stats, and Shield Health.

In the world of an Independent contractor, no Station is complete without a bustling hub of trade, entertainment... and the occasional black market deal. When it comes to rest, relaxation and risky ventures, <color=#ffc926>District 56</color> has everything that a dedicated Independent could ever need.

Every 5 levels upgraded in <color=#ffc926>District 56</color> resets the cooldown and increases the rewards given in the <color=#ffc926>District 56</color> free claim in the <color=#FFC926>Mirror Refinery</color>.

Produces Tritanium, an alloy many times harder than diamonds, used to construct mighty ships. Upgrading Tritanium Generators increases the amount that is produced, and unlocks the production of Σ-Tritanium at high levels.

The Nova Squadron building is where the most promising cadets train to become the next generation of elite Starfleet officers. The skill within increases SHP, Cost Efficiency for Building Materials, and Weapon Damage.

Independent Archives provide an in-depth analysis of the day-to-day activities of an Independent operator, as well as vital buffs and resources that can provide a tactical edge when engaging in these activities.

The DTI houses a powerful temporal matter converter that unlocks the power to transmute materials. The Material Converter applies high concentrations of tachyon energy to artificially refine the material, converting it into different types of the same grade and rarity For example, G4 Rare Ore -> G4 Rare Crystal. It also has the ability to convert materials into different rarities of the same type and grade! For example, G4 Uncommon Crystal -> G4 Rare Crystal.

This technology is unstable and requires additional investment before safeties can be lifted higher grades of materials can be refined. Grade 4 is available at level 30, Grade 5 is available at Level 40, Grade 6 is available at Level 50.

A recurring claim of Bonus Converter Tokens is unlocked at level 40. These can be used with Bonus Converter Refineries which have no tax and no cooldown. A one time claim of 5 tokens is unlocked at levels 20, 30, 50, 60 and 70.

The <color=#ffc926>Transogen Forge</color> provides bonuses to Common, <color=#66ff66>Uncommon</color> and <color=#00b4ff>Rare</color> Transogen Mining Speed and increases the rewards from their respective refineries. 

It also unlocks the Forge Exocomp slot, which can be used with powerful Forge Consumables.

Alongside this it unlocks One-Time Reward bundles of Refined Transogen, Parsteel, Tritanium, Dilithium, Sigma Speeds and Materials if the Forge Reward Claim Unlock research node is researched.

Recon Locus vigilantly monitors novel intel, clandestine technologies, and secret projects to keep the Station up to the highest standards. Use Recon Locus to improve Building and Research Speed and safeguard your fleet from Hyperthermic Decay.

Reach level 51 of Recon Locus to unlock the <color=#00b4ff>Orion Syndicate Bomb</color> Prototype Tech for free!

As an Independent operator's Station continues to develop and grow, so too does their reputation. Following the emergence of new and significant threats throughout the galaxy, a select few of the most prosperous Independents have been commissioned to engage and neutralize hostile Outposts. The Outpost Control Center enables an Independent to coordinate large-scale fleets and oversee assaults on Outposts with ease. Use the Outpost Control Center to generate Material Fragments.

Reach level 40 of Outpost Control Center to increase the <color=#00b4ff>Outpost Fleet size</color> by 1, and level 67 to unlock an additional <color=#00b4ff>Fleet preset</color>!

Material Fragments collected from this building can be exchanged for materials of your choice in the Outpost Refinery. As you level up the building higher grades and rarities of material exchanges will unlock and improve!
•Level 1: Unlock 5★ <color=#00ed4b>Uncommon</color>
•Level 15: Improve 5★ <color=#00ed4b>Uncommon</color>
•Level 20: Unlock 5★ <color=#00b4ff>Rare</color>
•Level 30: Improve 5★ <color=#00b4ff>Rare</color>
•Level 37: Unlock 6★ <color=#00ed4b>Uncommon</color>
•Level 45: Improve 6★ <color=#00ed4b>Uncommon</color>
•Level 50: Unlock 5★ <color=#ee84ff>Epic</color>
•Level 55: Improve 5★ <color=#ee84ff>Epic</color>
•Level 60: Unlock 7★ <color=#00ed4b>Uncommon</color>
•Level 63: Improve 7★ <color=#00ed4b>Uncommon</color>
•Level 67: Unlock 6★ <color=#00b4ff>Rare</color>
•Level 70: Improve 6★ <color=#00b4ff>Rare</color>
•Level 75: Unlock 7★ <color=#00b4ff>Rare</color>
•Level 80: Improve 7★ <color=#00b4ff>Rare</color>

The Signal Observatory increases Challenge Credits and FKR Credits earned from the V'ger Challenge Track. Reaching key milestones will immediately add a gift to the Challenge Refinery of Challenge Credits and FKR Exchange Tokens. When the Challenge Track next resets, the rewards will increase! Gifts and Challenge Track Rewards: Level 10: •Challenge Refinery Gift Level 20: •Challenge Refinery Gift •Challenge Track Tier 2 (+20% Challenge Credits | +10% FKR Credits) Level 30: •Challenge Refinery Gift •Challenge Track Tier 3 (+30% Challenge Credits | +15% FKR Credits) Level 40: •Challenge Refinery Gift •Challenge Track Tier 4 (+40% Challenge Credits | +20% FKR Credits) Level 50: •Challenge Refinery Gift •Challenge Track Tier 5 (+50% Challenge Credits | +25% FKR Credits) Level 60: •Challenge Refinery Gift •Challenge Track Tier 6 (+60% Challenge Credits | +30% FKR Credits) Level 70: •Challenge Refinery Gift •Challenge Track Tier 7 (+90% Challenge Credits | +40% FKR Credits) Level 71: •Free Daily V'ger Bounty Challenge Level 75: •Challenge Refinery Gift •Challenge Track Tier 8 (+120% Challenge Credits | +50% FKR Credits) Level up the building to: •Increase Base Damage vs V'ger hostiles •Increase Isolytic Defense vs Players for your G5+ FKR ships •Increase Critical Damage vs non-Armada Hostiles for your G5+ FKR ships •Increase base Cost Efficiency of 7⇵ Uncommon Materials for Station buildings The Signal Observatory is a subspace radio telescope, built around a living database of new and legacy transmission technologies.
Stores all collected Tritanium and Σ-Tritanium. Upgrade the Warehouse to increase its capacity and unlock Σ-Tritanium capacity at high levels.

Produces Dilithium, a crystalline mineral required when researching new technologies and building advanced ship components. Upgrading Dilithium Generators increases the amount that is produced, and unlocks the production of Σ-Dilithium at high levels.
The Weapon Damage of all your ships is increased each time you upgrade the Operations building.
The Shield Health of all your Explorers is increased each time you upgrade the Science Lab building.
The base Parsteel Production Rate Per Hour of this Generator is increased each time you upgrade it.
The Parsteel Storage indicates how much Parsteel this Generator can hold at once. It increases each time you upgrade it.
The base Tritanium Production Rate Per Hour of this Generator is increased each time you upgrade it.
The Tritanium Storage indicates how much Tritanium this Generator can hold at once. It increases each time you upgrade it.
The base Dilithium Production Rate Per Hour of this Generator is increased each time you upgrade it.
The Dilithium Storage indicates how much Dilithium this Generator can hold at once. It increases each time you upgrade it.
The Maximum amount of Parsteel you can stock from the Generators is increased each time you upgrade the Parsteel Warehouse.
The amount of Parsteel that cannot be stolen when your station gets attacked is increased each time you upgrade the Parsteel Vault.
The Maximum amount of Tritanium you can stock from the Generators is increased each time you upgrade the Tritanium Warehouse.
The amount of Tritanium that cannot be stolen when your station gets attacked is increased each time you upgrade the Tritanium Vault.
The Maximum amount of Dilithium you can stock from the Generators is increased each time you upgrade the Dilithium Warehouse.
The amount of Dilithium that cannot be stolen when your station gets attacked is increased each time you upgrade the Dilithium Vault.
The Research and Development building increases your Research speed each time you upgrade it.
Defense Platforms protect your Station from other players' attacks.
The Repair Speed for the ship that is affiliated to this Drydock is increased every time you upgrade it.
The Repair Costs for the ship that is affiliated to this Drydock is decreased every time you upgrade it.
The Inventory indicates how many ships you can have in total, including ones that are not affiliated to a Drydock.
The Construction Speed for all ships you construct is increased every time you upgrade the Shipyard.
The Tier Up Speed for all ships you upgrade is increased every time you upgrade the Shipyard.
The Cost Efficiency of all Research for base resources is increased
Increases the Weapon Damage of your ships when they take part in an Armada attack on a Hostile target.
Increases the maximum number of ships that can take part in your Armada attacks on Hostile targets.
The Scrapping Speed for all ships you scrap is increased every time you upgrade the Scrapyard.
The Building Cost Efficiency increases the cost efficiency of Parsteel, Tritanium, and Dilithium when upgrading all buildings.
The Component Cost Efficiency increases the cost efficiency of Parsteel, Tritanium, and Dilithium when constructing all ship components.
The Research Cost Efficiency increases the cost efficiency of Parsteel, Tritanium, and Dilithium for all research.
The Dodge value of all your ships is increased each time you upgrade the Engine Technology Lab building.
The Shield Health of all your Interceptors is increased each time you upgrade the Engine Technology Lab building.
The Armor, Shield Deflection and Dodge of your Defense Platforms is increased each time you upgrade the Defense Technologies building.
The Weapon Damage dealt by your Defense Platforms is increased each time you upgrade the Defense Technologies building.
The Weapon Damage dealt by your Defense Platforms is increased each time you upgrade the Defense Technologies building.
The Weapon Damage dealt by your Defense Platforms is increased each time you upgrade the Defense Technologies building.
The Weapon Damage dealt by your Defense Platforms is increased each time you upgrade the Defense Technologies building.
The Weapon Damage dealt by your Defense Platforms is increased each time you upgrade the Defense Technologies building.
The Hull Health of all your ships is increased each time you upgrade the Ship Hangar.
The Attack, Defense and Health of all your Officer are increased each time you upgrade the Academy.
Increases the cost efficiency of Service Awards when used for research.
Increases the weapon damage of your ships.
The Chances of getting a Critical Hit are increased each time you upgrade the Armory.
The amount of Axionic Chips that can be claimed daily in the Consumables Store is increased.
The mining speed of Survey ships is increased when the Treasury is upgraded.
The protected cargo size of Survey ships is increased when the Treasury is upgraded.
The maximum cargo capacity of all ships is increased when the Treasury is upgraded.
The grade of Exocomp Consumables that can be purchased in the Consumables Store is increased.

Additional Exocomps are unlocked. Exocomps can activate Consumables.
Level 1: +1 Galaxy Exocomp
Level 5: +1 Station Exocomp
Level 15: +1 Combat Exocomp
Level 35: +1 Multi-purpose Exocomp

Enables the detection of cloaked ships when an Assault occurs against your Alliance Starbase. 

Only cloaked ships of the assaulting Alliance are detected inside the same system as your Alliance Starbase.
The Damage dealt by Critical Hits is increased each time you upgrade the Armory.

Borg Type 03 Solo Armadas found near <link="fleetcommand://link/navigation/galaxy?ID=806106205"><color=#3db4cc>Veridian</color></link> can only be fought with 1 ship instead of 3 due to Q's Interference.
The Attack, Defense, and Health of all of your Officers are increased each time you upgrade the Command Center.

Additional Fleet Commander slots are unlocked. 
Slot 1: Command Center level 1
Slot 2: Command Center level 40
A one time reward of Uncommon Skill Points is granted each time you upgrade the Command Center.
The Attack, Defense, and Health of all of your Officers are increased each time you upgrade the Mess Hall.
Increases Research Speed each time you upgrade the Mess Hall.
Increases Tritanium Cost Efficiency for ship components each time you upgrade the Mess Hall.
The Weapon Damage of all of your ships is increased each time you upgrade the Mess Hall.
The amount of Artifact Tokens gained from defeating Formation Armadas is increased each time you upgrade the Artifact Gallery.
The Hull Health of all of your ships is increased each time you upgrade the Artifact Gallery.
The Shield Health of all of your ships is increased each time you upgrade the Artifact Gallery.
The Protomatter rewarded from completing a Trial is increased each time you upgrade the Court of Q building.
The Damage dealt by Critical Hits against Players is increased each time you upgrade the Court of Q.
The Damage dealt by Critical Hits against Hostiles is increased each time you upgrade the Court of Q.
The Damage dealt by Critical Hits against your deployed ships by players is reduced each time you upgrade the Court of Q.
The Armor value of all your ships is increased each time you upgrade the Foundry.
Increases the cost efficiency of Crystal, Gas, and Ore when used for buildings.
Increases the cost efficiency of Crystal, Gas, and Ore when used for research.
Increases the cost efficiency of Merits of Honor when used for research.

The Maximum amount of Σ-Parsteel you can stock from the Generators is increased each time you upgrade the Parsteel Warehouse.
The amount of Σ-Parsteel that cannot be stolen when your station gets attacked is increased each time you upgrade the Parsteel Vault.
The Σ-Tritanium Production Rate Per Hour of this Generator is increased each time you upgrade it.
The Σ-Tritanium Storage indicates how much Σ-Tritanium this Generator can hold at once. It increases each time you upgrade it.
The Maximum amount of Σ-Tritanium you can stock from the Generators is increased each time you upgrade the Tritanium Warehouse.
The amount of Σ-Tritanium that cannot be stolen when your station gets attacked is increased each time you upgrade the Tritanium Vault.
The Σ-Dilithium Production Rate Per Hour of this Generator is increased each time you upgrade it.
The Σ-Dilithium Storage indicates how much Σ-Dilithium this Generator can hold at once. It increases each time you upgrade it.
The Maximum amount of Σ-Dilithium you can stock from the Generators is increased each time you upgrade the Dilithium Warehouse.
The amount of Σ-Dilithium that cannot be stolen when your station gets attacked is increased each time you upgrade the Dilithium Vault.

Production indicates the base amount of Material Fragments generated per hour by the Outpost Control Center. This amount increases each time you upgrade the building.

Storage indicates the base amount of Material Fragments that can be held by the Outpost Control Center before getting full and needing to be collected. This increases each time you upgrade the building.
Increases your Outpost Fleet size by 2 at Level 1, and by 1 at Level 40.

Capacity indicates the base amount of Material Fragments that can be stored at the station in total. Once reaching this cap the Outpost Control Center will stop generating Material Fragments. This increases each time you upgrade the building.
